questions.question: Who drafts a new bill once it is introduced?
answers: The President
The Speaker of the House
A Senator from the opposing party
A Representative known as the 'sponsor'

questions.question: Who assigns a bill to a committee in the House of Representatives?
answers: The President
The Speaker of the House
The Vice President
The Majority Leader of the Senate

questions.question: What are the roles of a subcommittee vs. committee in the legislative process? ![](/images/0/q3img.png)
answers: A
B
C
D

questions.question: What happens during a 'markup session'?
answers: The bill is debated by the entire chamber.
The subcommittee proposes amendments to the bill.
The President signs or vetoes the bill.
The bill is introduced to the other chamber of Congress.

questions.question: What is a 'discharge petition'?
answers: A method to send a bill directly to the President.
A way for the House of Representatives to bring a bill to the floor after 30 days in committee.
A procedure to remove a bill from consideration in Congress after 30 days in committee.
A tool used by the Senate to delay voting on a bill.

questions.question: Who sets the order of debate in the House of Representatives?
answers: The Vice President
The Speaker of the House
The Senate Majority Leader
The President Pro Tempore

questions.question: How do the House of Representatives and the Senate differ in their debate rules?
answers: The House allows filibusters while the Senate does not.
The House operates under structured debate with time limits, while the Senate allows more flexible discussion.
The Senate operates under structured debate with time limits, while the House allows more flexible discussion.
Both chambers operate under the same debate rules.

questions.question: What happens if the versions of a bill passed by the House and the Senate are not identical?
answers: The President decides which version to sign.
The bill is sent back to the committee for redrafting.
A conference committee is formed to reconcile the differences.
The bill is automatically vetoed.

questions.question: Which of the following accurately compares the roles of the President and Congress in the creation of a bill? ![](/images/0/q9img.png)
answers: A
B
C
D

questions.question: Number of bills enacted by each Congress in the United States from 1973 to 2023 © Statista 2024 https://www.statista.com/statistics/1361682/bills-passed-congress-us/ ![](/images/0/q12img.png) Which of the following claims does the graph best support?
answers: The average percentage of bills passed over time has decreased.
The Senate passed the most bills in 1977.
The least amount of bills were approved by both the House of Representatives and the Senate in the 118th congress.
The amount of bills that become law decreased from 2003 to 2009

questions.question: Number of bills enacted by each Congress in the United States from 1973 to 2023 © Statista 2024 https://www.statista.com/statistics/1361682/bills-passed-congress-us/ ![](/images/0/q12img.png) Which of the following could be an explanation for the trend shown in the graph?
answers: The public has on average grown more dissatisfied with representatives
Presidents has on average become older over time
There has been an increasing amount of political divide over time
The Supreme Court has declared laws passed by Congress unconstitutional

questions.question: ![](/images/0/q14img.png) Which statement would the artist of the cartoon most agree with?
answers: Representatives constantly oppose the legislation of their peers.
Parties in Congress are willing to compromise to achieve their goals
Filibusters are becoming too frequent in Congress
Parties in Congress have different priorities

questions.question: ![](/images/0/q14img.png) What is an issue that would most likely arise from the problem presented in the cartoon?
answers: Decreased congressional productivity
The President will pass the budget instead of Congress
Congressmen of the same party will work together to vote out opposing party members
The U.S. will go into deficit spending
